title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 18 December 2013 - XWiki

09:50 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <camil7> has quit  
09:55 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <DarkKnightCZ> has xwiki some kind of notification api? i need to notify user on complete asynchronous task (email for example)  
10:03 <camil7> smells like notifications http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/GroovyNotificationTutorial  (ah, docs are deprecated ...)  
10:12 <DarkKnightCZ> camil7: these are event bindings, i'm creating this event, so i don't need these kind of notifications (i need to notify user... i can get user email, so something like this should be ok? http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Mail+Sender+Plugin )  
10:12 <camil7> ah you wondered how to actually send the mail  
10:16 <camil7> yes, as far as I can see the MailSenderPlugin is still the way to go  
10:17 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, thanks  
10:28 <DarkKnightCZ> just wondering, $xwiki.mailsender is equivalent to context.getWiki().getPluginApi("mailsender",context) or injecting MailSenderPlugin?  
10:32 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: you can't inject MailSenderPlugin, this is old stuff and not a component  
10:33 <tmortagne> and yes $xwiki.mailsender is equivalent to context.getWiki().getPluginApi("mailsender",context)  
10:33 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: ok, thanks  
10:49 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:33 <j-simard> has quit  
11:52 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:53 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
12:14 <DarkKnightCZ> where does LogFactory prints content? (MailSenderPlugin return only 0/-1 status and i need to see stacktrace, which should occur in default log file, but it doesn't)  
12:22 <camil7> stack trace should be written to System.err - wherever that is. If you cannot find it, maybe add your own logback.xml  and configure a log file  
12:23 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: what application server are you using ?  
12:23 <tmortagne> usually the log end up in your application server default log file  
12:23 <tmortagne> in case of jetty+hsqldb distribution it ends up in the standard output only (no file)  
12:25 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: jetty... standart output logs to default log file, err has separate file, but it does not have specified error  
12:25 <evalica> has quit  
12:28 <DarkKnightCZ> i see every unhandled exceptions, every logging using Logger, but no message with LogFactory (not even info)  
12:29 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: not sure what LogFactory you are talking about, every Logger is created using a LogFactory  
12:29 <tmortagne> LoggerFactory actually in case of slf4j  
12:31 <DarkKnightCZ> well, Components (and everything current) use slf4j for logging, plugins (or maybe only MailSenderPlugin) uses apache logging (org.apache.commons.logging.Log/LogFactory)  
12:36 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, i may be looking into bad file :) MailSenderPlugin is now part of platform, right?  
12:36 <tmortagne> always been part of platform  
12:37 <tmortagne> and it's using slf4j  
12:37 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:37 <tmortagne> even if it's not a component  
12:37 <tmortagne> platform used to use commons-logging but that was a long time ago now  
12:38 <DarkKnightCZ> yep, i was looking into com.xpn.xwiki.platform.plugins, which is probably old  
12:40 <tmortagne> the current version is https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-mailsender/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/plugin/mailsender/MailSenderPlugin.java  
12:40 <DarkKnightCZ> thanks  
12:48 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:51 <evalica> has quit  
12:51 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
13:20 <tmortagne> has quit  
13:21 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
13:23 <tmortagne> has quit  
13:23 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
14:14 <Kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
14:29 <Kaisen> Hello, I have one short question. I have a system with provides different RSS feeds. As this systems runs with HTTPS and the certificate is not set I cannot implement it over the rss feed macro.  
14:30 <Kaisen> Is there a way that I can tell the macro that we "trust" the side in any way?  
14:30 <Kaisen> Or does the macro did support https  
14:48 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
15:01 <sburjan> has quit  
15:01 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
15:29 <GuillaumeF> has quit  
15:40 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, i still cannot get plugin logging working... every small insignificant message is shown onto stdout, but error message from plugin isn't, any ideas?  
15:41 <DarkKnightCZ> (logback.xml is the same as in example)  
15:43 <camil7> any chance the plugin is actually not called (i.e. small typo somewhere?)  
15:44 <DarkKnightCZ> plugin is called... it has api that calls the plugin, api is separated (returns only 0/-1 if its ok/bad) and in plugin it should log the exception, but all i get is -1 and nothing in stdout  
15:50 <GuillaumeF> has joined #xwiki  
15:52 <camil7> is the logger listed in the admin UI? e.g. http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=globaladmin&section=Logging#|t=logging&p=1&l=15&s=logger&d=asc&logger=MailSender  
15:55 <msmeria> has quit  
16:01 <DarkKnightCZ> yep... so i set everything to trace and now it shows the error...  
16:02 <DarkKnightCZ> setting trace to mailsender only didn't work...
